intro: Hieracium beudense, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium beudense is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
